title: Inside Lea Michele’s home as it goes on sale for $3 million
text:
Fancy chipping in to buy this with us? (Picture: Backgrid)

Lea Michele has opened the doors to her gorgeous Hollywood home as she puts the property on the market for a staggering $3.15 million (£2.48 million).

The Glee star has lived in the four bedroom, four bathroom mansion in Brentwood, Los Angeles for four years, but following her March wedding to clothing businessman Randy Zeich, the actress is looking to commemorate the new chapter in her life with a new home.

Listed for a whopping $3.15 million, having previously failed to meet its initial offer of $3.35 million (£2.64 million), Lea’s 3163 square foot pad features a pool, walk in closet, dance studio, art studio and gym. Standard, right?

With floor to ceiling iron windows, marble countertops and sleek monochrome finishings, Lea’s home is fulfilling all of our interior design dreams.

Described as a ‘beautifully remodelled, peaceful retreat ideally situated in the natural beauty of Upper Mandeville Canyon Dr,’ the property is said to offer ‘serene canyon views and complete privacy on a private cul-de-sac.’

‘This is truly an oasis and a respite from city life,’ the description finishes.

The singer and actress is leaving her Hollywood home behind (Picture: VALERIE MACON/AFP)

Imagine living in a house like this (Picture: MLS/BACKGRID)

Lea has an eye for interior design (Picture: MLS/BACKGRID)

We’re loving the monochrome look (Picture: MLS/BACKGRID)

Recently, 33-year-old Lea opened up about her ongoing battle with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).

Talking to Health magazine, the actress confessed: ‘The side effects can be brutal — like weight gain and bad skin.’

The star went onto say how she managed to keep things at bay while taking birth control pills, saying: ‘I [finally] went to a great doctor, and the minute she looked at me, she was like, “Oh, you have PCOS.” It explained everything.

‘Through diet, I have been able to manage it. But I am very fortunate,’ she insisted. ‘There are way more extreme versions of PCOS that women have a lot of difficulty with — mine is not as intense.’

Lea said: ‘Which is why I haven’t really talked about it, because there are women who have it so much more intense.’

We’re just glad you’re raising awareness, Lea.
